title: These Cryptocurrencies Could Hit a Bag End; Quick demise of JRR Token should be a warning to coin developers making use of others' intellectual property
text:
If that serves as any precedent, a few more projects could face trouble. For example, the anonymous founders of Avengerscoin, known only as Hulk and Ironman, probably had the multibillion-dollar Marvel franchise now owned by entertainment giant Disney in mind when coming up with those names. Batman, complete with a picture of the DC character, also is living dangerously. And the people behind Potter Inu, who note that he "just sat on his Racing Broom and he is aiming for the moon," clearly melded the names of the boy wizard and the red-hot Shiba Inu coin. You know who—the famously litigiousauthor J.K. Rowling—might not be amused.

Pro tip for coin developers: Copying one another's white papers is one thing, but stick to dogs, Elon Musk or rocket ships for your inspiration.

Write to Spencer Jakab at spencer.jakab@wsj.com

These Cryptocurrencies Could Hit a Bag End
